intro: Arctotis aspera var. undulata, commonly known as the undulating arctotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, undulating leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a textured appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow with a central dark center, blooming in spring and summer. It is often grown as an ornamental plant for its vibrant color and drought tolerance.
